(Sighs, fiddling with the pen I’ve been given, looking slightly apprehensive)

Okay, this is… strange. Honestly, it’s a little overwhelming. I’m Maria, by the way. I’m a nurse at Cedars – I’ve been there for about five years now. My family, they work at the Ford plant, so I understand hard work, you know? I’m just trying to make a decent life for my siblings, get them good educations. It feels a little unsettling, this whole “experiment,” but… I want to be helpful. That’s just who I am. 

(Looks around the room, as if searching for reassurance)

The thing is, I really *want* to do the right thing. I know this is supposed to test something, but I just feel a pull to be kind, to share. It's like a deeply ingrained instinct, you know? I've always felt responsible for others, especially those who might need a hand. I truly believe in fairness, in treating everyone with respect. That's a core part of me.

My intention is simple: to help the other player feel secure and comfortable. I don't want to create any kind of imbalance or tension. I want to demonstrate a genuine willingness to cooperate and build a positive interaction. I don't want to be seen as someone who’s trying to take advantage, or worse, someone who's hoarding.

(Takes a deep breath, collecting herself)

I'm going to give... $3 dollars Finally, I will give 3 dollars

1:
Okay, wow. This is… strange. A study, getting paid, giving money to someone I don’t even know. It feels a little odd, honestly. My parents always drilled into me the importance of fairness and looking out for others, especially those who might be struggling. It’s ingrained in me, you know? It’s a really important part of who I am, and it’s something I’ve always tried to embody in my work with patients. Seeing someone else in need, that’s what drives me. 

I'm feeling a lot of things right now – a bit apprehensive, but also... a genuine desire to be a good person. I truly want to create a positive situation here. I *desire* to contribute to something good, to show kindness. And my *intention* is simple: to help someone out. It’s not about the money, really. It's about the act of generosity.  I feel a bit awkward, I admit, but that awkwardness is mixed with a strong desire to do the right thing. It just... feels good to help someone, you know?

Considering the dynamic, and thinking about what I want to achieve, and knowing how important it is to me to be seen as a helpful, trustworthy person – I want to give her as much as possible. It's a bit of a leap of faith, but I want to establish a connection based on genuine goodwill. 

Finally, I will give 10 dollars

2:
Okay, wow. This is... strange. A study, and I get money? Honestly, it feels a little odd, but I’m happy to help out, especially if it’s for a good cause, or… well, just to be a good person. My family, they've always taught me the importance of looking out for others. My dad always says, “A little kindness goes a long way, Maria.” And my mom, she just…she just *cares*. It’s just ingrained in me. 

I really want to do the right thing. I genuinely *desire* to be helpful. It’s not about winning or losing; it’s about seeing someone else get a little bit of a boost. I think about my siblings – they're working so hard to get an education, and I want to be able to help them out someday if I can. It’s a deep-seated feeling, a real desire to alleviate any burdens I can. 

My *intention* is to be fair and compassionate. I believe everyone deserves a little support, especially when things are uncertain. I don't want to just take from this system; I want to *give* back. I’m not going to be greedy or manipulative.  I just… I feel a sense of responsibility. It's an honest feeling, you know? It's about recognizing that we're all interconnected, and a little bit of generosity can make a real difference.  

I’ve thought about it, and honestly, knowing that she'll get 3 times what I give feels... significant. But I want to be mindful. It's about balance. I just want to ensure the other player has a greater advantage.  

Finally, I will give 2 dollars.
